means: （中小学的）男生( schoolboy的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: They just rolled about on the floor punching each other like schoolboys.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们像小学生一样，在地板上滚来滚去，互相挥着拳头揍对方。

sentence.Network_en: They met up in 1956, when they were both young schoolboys.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们1956年相遇，那时他们俩都还是小男生。

sentence.Network_en: Many million of schoolboys and schoolgirls are trying to do so.
sentence.Network_cn: 成千上万在学的男孩和女孩正在努力学习英语.

PerfectNetExp.abs: qq分组英文名称_百度知道 ... families（ 家人） schoolboys（ 男同学） schoolgirls（ 女同学）.
But , bad for schoolboys , it did so happen that they were passably good for him ., 不过对懒学生是坏事 , 对他却有好处 , 这话也说到家了.
schoolboys ; the soldier was AWOL for almost a week ., 逃课的男学生 ; 这个士兵擅离职守几乎一个星期了.
Many million of schoolboys and schoolgirls are trying to do so ., 成千上万在学的男孩和女孩正在努力学习英语.

list.abs: ...我同时也踢足球,我常常舍弃拳击训练而去踢球,但在我十二岁时,我获得了自己的第一个拳击方面的头衔,大不列颠学校男孩儿,British schoolboy,的头衔,由此,我意识到,如果我真的想要在某一项运动上专精,我不得不放弃其它的几项运动,我拳头的速度.
schoolboy dormitory berth leaves a message to what be the same as bed upper berth .男生宿舍下铺给同床上铺的留言。
within forty minutes her head was coveded with tiny , closelying curls that made her look wonderfully like a truant schoolboy .不出40分钟，她头上不满紧帖头皮的小卷发，变得活像一个逃学的小学生。
a schoolboy found this wallet in the street ., 一个学生在街上捡到这个钱包.

entry.def: A schoolboy is a boy who goes to school.
If you think a man's sense of humour is silly or rude, you can describe it as schoolboy humour.

auth_sentence.content: They were fit young schoolboys and we were unsound in wind and full of beer.
auth_sentence.res_content: They were fit young schoolboys and we were unsound in wind and full of beer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They were fit young schoolboys and we were unsound in wind and full of beer.

auth_sentence.content: Of course, the public schoolboys still held on to a disproportionate share of the top jobs.
auth_sentence.res_content: Of course, the public schoolboys still held on to a disproportionate share of the top jobs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Of course, the public schoolboys still held on to a disproportionate share of the top jobs.

auth_sentence.content: "Public schoolboys dominate sports, arts and the technology section," Dr Sewell told the BBC.
auth_sentence.res_content: "Public schoolboys dominate sports, arts and the technology section," Dr Sewell told the BBC.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Public schoolboys dominate sports, arts and the technology section," Dr Sewell told the BBC.
